A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This could have been a great movie. Many people are saying that fanboys are rejecting this movie because it does not indulge their theories and the plot twists are too much to handle. I dont think that is true\, at least not in my case. I dont mind Rey being of no specific lineage or even that Luke was not the same Luke many of us might have hoped for. There were no real plot twists in my opinion. Rey and Kylo could have had much more interesting character arcs but instead we are still left with good girl and bad guy. Now the nitty gritty wrongs I found in the movie...
Kylo easily kills an extremely powerful Sith Lord but can barely handle his guards? 
Po is just an immature\, gun busting hot head in this? What a waste of a character!
Hux\, who gave one of my favorite performances in TFA when he gives the strong speech before firing Starkiller Base... is now a laughable goon.
Bad\, BAD joke after joke that always misses. 
Leia in space\, yea no.
Corny CGI animals & aliens\, after JJ made a push for more hands on special effects for creatures in TFA.
Rey is way too skilled with the Force without training.
The casino\, useless filler\, if not to only introduce Benicio for possible future involvement in the series.
Its just lazy filmmaking from a technical standpoint.
